availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William T. Stearman (Green County, Kentucky, soldier.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Green County, Kentucky, native. Married to Elizabeth "Bettie" A. Marcum Stearman in Green County, Kentucky, on July 9, 1863. Father of Robert H. Stearman and William G. Stearman. Farmer in Green County in 1861. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 31, 1861, to August 13, 1862. Discharged on August 13, 1862, on account of disability.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Precinct, p. 423A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0268.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Green County Marriages, Film 001877085.
